item.title: Heart-warming sketches from St Trinians’ creator
item.author: Cecily Goodwin,
item.description: In 1969, cartoonist Ronald Searle’s wife Monica was diagnosed with a particularly virulent form of breast cancer and given six months to live. She went on to undergo a series of experimental and particularly unpleasant chemotherapy treatments. During this distressing period, Searle was determined to …

item.title: Go Go Go Gauguin
item.author: Cecily Goodwin,
item.description: Tate Modern’s exhibition on Gauguin is his first international exhibition for more than 50 years. It documents his shifting styles, focusing on his interest in depicting myth and the supernatural, and culminating in his most famous works painted in Tahiti. As well as allowing the viewer to …
